questions.question_text: Where is the log level for the environment defined when using an on-premises Workspace ONE UEM?

discussion.content:
It is A - There are two logging levels that provide different levels of detail. To reduce the use of hardware
resources, set the logging level to disabled if you are not troubleshooting a service.
1 In the console with a system administrator level account at the global organization group,
navigate to Groups & Settings > All Settings > Admin > Diagnostics > Logging.
2 Select a service that needs an increased logging level. Set the service logging to Enabled.
3 After you finish troubleshooting, revert the logging level to Disabled to preserve hardware
resources.

choices.B: The network ports 5228-5230 are blocked outgoing.
choices.D: The network ports 5228-5230 are blocked incoming.
choices.A: The network ports 2195 and 2196 are blocked incoming.
choices.C: The network ports 2195 and 2196 are blocked outgoing.

questions.question_text:
An administrator has an on-premises Workspace ONE UEM which has a valid Apple Push Notification service (APNs) certificate. No iOS apps can be installed.
What could be the problem?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
port 2195 for gateway.push.apple.com
port 2196 for feedback.push.apple.com
ports 5228-5230 for Android only

choices.D: The internal app was built using Crosswalk on Android.
choices.B: The maximum count of wrapped applications has been reached.
choices.A: AppWrapping license is not assigned to the failed application.
choices.C: AppWrapping works only with internal iOS applications.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is trying to enable AppWrapping for a special internal Android application, but the application fails to get wrapped. Other internal applications are wrapped without complications.
What could cause this failure?

discussion.content:
Yes, Answer is D

Android Apps Built with Crosswalk Project Libraries Do Not Wrap
Crosswalk on Android provides a packaging tool and a Java wrapper layer. They can bundle Web applications into the Android Web app APKs. This Java wrapper layer calls Crosswalk runtime, and Crosswalk runtime is a full-featured Web engine mostly written in C/C++. Android platforms do not package C/C++ code into SMALI files, and the app wrapping solution cannot modify and wrap the C/C++ libraries and code.

questions.question_text:
Drive C: is used as an installation drive in an on-premises Workspace ONE UEM environment.
What is the correct path to the log files?

discussion.content:
I suggest C

example: Console Logging
Learn more about the Workspace ONE UEM logging functions available for the Console service. The API service is installed by default. All Logs are located in the /VMware/AirWatch/Logs folder unless otherwise specified.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/services/WS1_Logging.pdf
Per the Prep exam information - the default location for the logs on prem is C:\AirWatch\Logs

comments.content: agree with the B answer as well

discussion.content:
Answer: B
This is the only answer that makes sense.

choices.A: Factory reset the device and re-enroll the device.
choices.D: Delete the intelligent HUB app from the device.
choices.C: Update the mobile OS on the device if possible.
